title: Special Agent - a Secret Agent fangame
content:
Recently, there was a game released on the Click community (for Multimedia Fusion and the like). It's a Secret Agent fangame, and I think it rocks!

[url=http://wired.st-and.ac.uk/~wong/agent/zips/specialagent.zip]wired.st-and.ac.uk/~wong/...lagent.zip[/url] to download! Enjoy! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Special Agent - a Secret Agent fangame
content: Wow. This reminds me why it is I make games. Absolutely beautiful. Faithful as a remake, but also incredibly well polished and shiny.

title: Re: Special Agent - a Secret Agent fangame
content:
With my crappy Internet connection, I wasn't going to do it, but a mysterious hidden energy forced me to download it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Awesome! It's interesting to see how simple colorful graphics can still make an awesome game. And the background music is excellent (for a fan-game), and it is composed of several Impulse Tracker files! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
[hr][img]http://img136.imageshack.us/img136/983/vegetableswk2.gif[/img]

title: Re: Special Agent - a Secret Agent fangame
content:
Yeah, it's got a lot SGA in it! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Anyways, yeah, I played the game too. It was pretty good, I don't usually just download and play games, I was happily surprised this time. Good graphics, sounds, music, and engine. Are the levels the same as in original Special Agent (I know there wasn't this mission stuff, but I mean the design)? I can't remember at all. But either the way, they were good too.

I finished the levels, but I won't bother trying to play them again in some other game mode, so I'm done with it now..3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Special Agent - a Secret Agent fangame
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Are the levels the same as in original Special Agent (I know there wasn't this mission stuff, but I mean the design)?[hr][/quote]
No, almost all levels are unique. Except for DVS Security Center, which pretty much is a remake of a Secret Agent level. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________

title: Re: Special Agent - a Secret Agent fangame
content:
Grade S, you need every bonus:
SPY - Get S, P, and Y in the correct order.
Republican - Not sure how to get it, but I usually do.
Democrat - Don't shoot the gravestones
Briefcase - Collect all the briefcases (or every item?)
Time - Beat the level in under 3 minutes
Health - Don't get hurt
Camera - Shoot all of the cameras
If you can manage to do all of these, you'll get an S.

As for the secret level: (SPOILERS[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
The code is all over the last level, and in the subway level. I forget the code right now, but you'll see four tiles, each with a different color.
Now, go to the map. You'll see four flags on the north side of the map. Click S to change the colors. Make them match the four tiles in the levels. The gate to the secret level will open, and you can go to it. (there's no road that leads to it, but there will be an arrow pointing to it when you get to the right intersection.)-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Special Agent - a Secret Agent fangame
content:

title: Re: Special Agent - a Secret Agent fangame
content:
My ancient ezBoard account still works! =O

I found this thread on a Google search a while ago and just wanted to say that it's nice to know that people in this community appreciate the game.

I'm actually impressed that you worked out the requirements for the bonuses so specifically - I'd meant the more obscurely-named ones to be shrouded in mystery for a while yet [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] But to add to Genius314's list, the Briefcase bonus is for getting every scoring item (files, folders, briefcases) and the Republican Bonus can be gained by destroying all the plants on a level.

- David Newton (who was somehow possessed to use the Internet name you see on the left five years ago...)[hr]
[center]
[img]http://www.angelfire.com/alt/wong/images/sig.txt[/img]
[/center]

title: Re: Special Agent - a Secret Agent fangame
content:
heh cool. Btw will you release a level editor?----

Tough Bloogs eat princesses

Bit of a difficult one, that, as all the levels are stored in the EXE itself - if I'd thought of it earlier I might have had a go. However, the next project I'm working on (if I ever get around to getting it to work) is going to be entirely based on user-made levels, and will also be an update to a rather similar game...

title: Re: Special Agent - a Secret Agent fangame
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr][...] the next project I'm working on [...] will also be an update to a rather similar game...[hr][/quote]

Let me guess, Crystal Caves? That'd be cool! It's the first computer game I played in my life (and it's the cause of me getting my own computer [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] )!

EDIT: I guess it's CCaves because it uses a rather similar engine to that of Secret Agent, and has a pretty similar gameplay.[hr]SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"
